The Summarize Nearby tool calculates statistics for features within a specified distance of other features. The distance can be calculated using a straight line distance or a travel mode.

The layer that will be summarized within a distance of the nearby layer.

The count of features depends on additional factors such as filtering criteria and the analysis extent.

The point, line, or polygon layer that will be used as the starting locations around which bounding areas will be created to summarize nearby features.

The count of features depends on additional factors such as filtering criteria and the analysis extent.

The method that will be used to create the bounding areas. The method can be a straight line distance or a travel mode.

The method that will be used to create the bounding areas. Currently, straight line distance is the only method supported for models.

The distance or time that will be used to create bounding areas. If multiple values are added, each value will be used to calculate bounding areas for all input features.

The units that will be used to specify distance or time.

Specifies whether the result layer will be the bounding areas (checked) or the same geometry as the input nearby layer (unchecked).

Specifies whether the total size of the features summarized in each bounding area will be calculated. For lines, the total length will be calculated. For polygons, the total area will be calculated.

The units that will be used to calculate the total size of summarized features.

The number or date fields from the input layer that will be summarized, and the statistics that will be calculated for each field.

The field from the input layer that will be used to separate the data into distinct groups for statistical calculations.

Specifies whether to calculate the minority (least dominant) and majority (most dominant) groups within each summary area.

Specifies whether the percentage of the summarized features that belong to each group within each boundary will be calculated.

The name of the layer that will be created and added to the map.

The name of the folder in My content where the results will be saved.
